context: The word 'loki' in Finnish refers to a log, which can be a nautical log used to measure the speed of a vessel, or a chronological record of events. It is also used in computer science to refer to a log file that records system activity. The declension shows different forms depending on grammatical case (nominative, genitive, partitive etc.) and number (singular/plural). Possessive suffixes are added to indicate ownership ('lokini' - my log, 'lokisi' - your log, etc.).
